sections.name: Laruhao
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 41

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Backstabber
traits.text: When you hit an off-guard creature, this weapon deals 1 precision damage in addition to its normal damage. The precision damage increases to 2 if the weapon is a _+3 weapon_.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon’s damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon’s normal damage dice doesn’t change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Monk
traits.text: Abilities with this trait are from the monk class. A weapon with this trait is primarily used by monks.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

traits.name: Sonic
traits.text: An effect with the sonic trait functions only if it makes sound, meaning it has no effect in an area of silence or in a vacuum. This is different from an auditory spell, which is effective only if the target can hear it. A sonic effect might deal sonic damage.

ability.name: Call Dancers

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Healing
traits.text: A healing effect restores a creature’s body, typically by restoring Hit Points, but sometimes by removing diseases or other debilitating effects.

ability.text: Laruhao sends out a pulse of inviting melody that calls more yokai from the ether, restoring 30 Hit Points to the dancing night parade.

ability.name: Dance, Puppets, Dance!

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Linguistic
traits.text: An effect with this trait depends on language comprehension. A linguistic effect that targets a creature works only if the target understands the language you are using.

ability.text: Laruhao plays an invigorating melody that signals his horde to attack. The dancing night parade can use either Seiya! Soiya! or the two-action version of Wasshoi! Wasshoi! as a reaction.

ability.name: Master of Barriers
ability.text: Laruhao wishes for nothing more than to dance atop his yagura, undisturbed. When he uses his house of imaginary walls composition spell, he creates four 10-foot-by-10-foot walls in a cube around him. A creature must succeed at a DC 41 counteract check to teleport within these walls; otherwise, the teleportation attempt fails.
